channel.title: marieeugenie-maggia on Cottenie Lab
channel.description: Recent content in marieeugenie-maggia on Cottenie Lab

item.description: I am a PhD student in the Integrative Biology department, co-supervised by Dirk Steinke and Karl Cottenie. My research areas include community ecology and invertebrates (earthworms). Understanding how communities are formed enables us to predict their dynamics in response to environmental changes. This information is therefore of great value. Earthworms are abundant invertebrates representing an important part of soil biomass. They are involved in essential ecological processes that govern soil function and production of ecosystems services (key species).
